    • Method Detail

      • createP24Params

        @JvmStatic
 @NotNull
public SourceParams createP24Params(long amount,
                                                         @NotNull
                                                         java.lang.String currency,
                                                         @Nullable
                                                         java.lang.String name,
                                                         @NotNull
                                                         java.lang.String email,
                                                         @NotNull
                                                         java.lang.String returnUrl)

        Create P24 Source params.

        Parameters:
        amount - A positive integer in the smallest currency unit representing the amount tocharge the customer (e.g., 1099 for a â‚¬10.99 payment).
        currency - eur or pln (P24 payments must be in either Eurosor Polish Zloty).
        name - The name of the account holder (optional).
        email - The email address of the account holder.
        returnUrl - The URL the customer should be redirected to after the authorizationprocess.
        Returns:
        a class SourceParams that can be used to create a P24 source

      • createAlipayReusableParams

        @JvmStatic
 @NotNull
public SourceParams createAlipayReusableParams(@NotNull
                                                                    java.lang.String currency,
                                                                    @Nullable
                                                                    java.lang.String name,
                                                                    @Nullable
                                                                    java.lang.String email,
                                                                    @NotNull
                                                                    java.lang.String returnUrl)

        Create reusable Alipay Source params.

        Parameters:
        currency - The currency of the payment. Must be the default currency for your country.Can be aud, cad, eur, gbp, hkd, jpy, nzd, sgd, or usd. Users in Denmark,Norway, Sweden, or Switzerland must use eur.
        name - The name of the account holder (optional).
        email - The email address of the account holder (optional).
        returnUrl - The URL the customer should be redirected to after the authorizationprocess.
        Returns:
        a class SourceParams that can be used to create an Alipay reusable source

        currency - The currency of the payment. Must be the default currency for your country.Can be aud, cad, eur, gbp, hkd, jpy, nzd, sgd, or usd. Users in Denmark,Norway, Sweden, or Switzerland must use eur.

      • createWeChatPayParams

        @JvmStatic
 @NotNull
public SourceParams createWeChatPayParams(long amount,
                                                               @NotNull
                                                               java.lang.String currency,
                                                               @NotNull
                                                               java.lang.String weChatAppId,
                                                               @Nullable
                                                               java.lang.String statementDescriptor)

        Create WeChat Pay Source params.

        Parameters:
        amount - A positive integer in thesmallest currency unitrepresenting the amount to charge the customer (e.g., 1099 for a $10.99 payment).
        currency - The currency of the payment. Must be the default currency for yourcountry. Can be aud, cad, eur, gbp, hkd, jpy, sgd, or usd.
        weChatAppId - Your registered WeChat Pay App ID fromWeChat Open Platform.
        statementDescriptor - (optional) A custom statement descriptor for the payment,maximum 32 characters. By default, your Stripe accountâ€™s statement descriptor isused (you can review this in the Dashboard.

      • createKlarna

        @JvmStatic
 @NotNull
public SourceParams createKlarna(@NotNull
                                                      java.lang.String returnUrl,
                                                      @NotNull
                                                      java.lang.String currency,
                                                      @NotNull
                                                      KlarnaSourceParams klarnaParams)

        Create params for a Klarna Source

        Klarna Payments with Sources

        Parameters:
        returnUrl - The URL you provide to redirect the customer back to you after theyauthenticated their payment. It can use your application URI scheme in the context ofa mobile application.
        currency - Three-letter ISO code for the currency associated with the source.This is the currency for which the source will be chargeable once ready.
        klarnaParams - Klarna-specific params
        See Also:
        Klarna Payments with Sources

      • createBancontactParams

        @JvmStatic
 @NotNull
public SourceParams createBancontactParams(long amount,
                                                                @NotNull
                                                                java.lang.String name,
                                                                @NotNull
                                                                java.lang.String returnUrl,
                                                                @Nullable
                                                                java.lang.String statementDescriptor,
                                                                @Nullable
                                                                java.lang.String preferredLanguage)

        Create Bancontact Source params.

        Parameters:
        amount - A positive integer in the smallest currency unit representing the amount tocharge the customer (e.g., 1099 for a â‚¬10.99 payment). The charge amount must beat least â‚¬1 or its equivalent in the given currency.
        name - The full name of the account holder.
        returnUrl - The URL the customer should be redirected to after the authorizationprocess.
        statementDescriptor - A custom statement descriptor for the payment (optional).
        preferredLanguage - The preferred language of the Bancontact authorization page that thecustomer is redirected to. Supported values are: en, de, fr, or nl(optional).
        Returns:
        a class SourceParams object that can be used to create a Bancontact source

      • createSepaDebitParams

        @JvmStatic
 @NotNull
public SourceParams createSepaDebitParams(@NotNull
                                                               java.lang.String name,
                                                               @NotNull
                                                               java.lang.String iban,
                                                               @Nullable
                                                               java.lang.String addressLine1,
                                                               @NotNull
                                                               java.lang.String city,
                                                               @NotNull
                                                               java.lang.String postalCode,
                                                               @NotNull
                                                               java.lang.String country)

        Create SEPA Debit Source params.

        Parameters:
        name - The full name of the account holder.
        iban - The IBAN number for the bank account that you wish to debit.
        addressLine1 - The first line of the owner's address (optional).
        city - The city of the owner's address.
        postalCode - The postal code of the owner's address.
        country - The ISO-3166 2-letter country code of the owner's address.
        Returns:
        a class SourceParams object that can be used to create a SEPA debit source

      • createRetrieveSourceParams

 @NotNull

                                                                                                        java.lang.String clientSecret)

        Create parameters needed to retrieve a source.

        Parameters:
        clientSecret - the client secret for the source, needed because the Android SDK usesa public key
        Returns:
        a Map matching the parameter name to the client secret, ready to send to the server.
